page.title: 07 HAWKESYARD PRIORY, RUGELEY.
page.content: Located between Rugeley and Armitage, it was built as a Study House for the English Dominicans c1900-1915.It is now part of the Spode Conference Centre run by the Dominicans. The Priory Church, still in use, has a high arched timber roof and carved wooden choir stalls. The wall behind the altar is filled with stone carvings of the Saints surmounted by a large crucifix. The floor is covered by mosaic tiles. In the Lady Chapel there is a carved wooden statue to St.Martin de Porres. Left of the altar an arched door leads to the cloisters, which were never completed. The rooms off the cloisters include the kitchens and the library The domed library roof is glazed, with- in an iron frame. There is a cast iron, spiral staircase to a surrounding balcony, decorated with wrought iron and supported by cast iron pillars.
